TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit ExtendedProtectionPolicy extends System.Object implements class System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable

Docs.summary: The ExtendedProtectionPolicy class represents the extended protection policy used by the server to validate incoming client connections.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Any classes that expose the ExtendedProtectionPolicy class should not allow the setting of null policies, should supply a default policy, or should require an explicit policy to be created and set by the application developer or administrator.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.PolicyEnforcement policyEnforcement) cil managed

Docs.param: A value that indicates when the extended protection policy should be enforced.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that specifies when the extended protection policy should be enforced.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When this constructor is used to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy> class, the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy.PolicyEnforcement%2A> property is set to the `policyEnforcement` parameter and the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy.ProtectionScenario%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ProtectionScenario>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, valuetype System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from a object that contains the required data to populate the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor implements the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable?displayProperty=fullName> interface for the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy> class.
The <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy.System%23Runtime%23Serialization%23ISerializable%23GetObjectData%2A> method can be used to serialize an <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy> object. This serialized object can then be used with ExtendedProtectionPolicy to construct a new <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy> object.

Docs.param: A value that indicates when the extended protection policy should be enforced.
A <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ChannelBinding> that contains a custom channel binding to use for validation.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that specifies when the extended protection policy should be enforced and the channel binding token (CBT) to be used.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When this constructor is used to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy> class, the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy.PolicyEnforcement%2A> property is set to the `policyEnforcement` parameter, the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy.CustomChannelBinding%2A> property is set to the `customChannelBinding` parameter, and the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy.ProtectionScenario%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ProtectionScenario>.

A value that indicates the kind of protection enforced by the policy.
A <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> that contains the custom SPN list that is used to match against a client's SPN.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that specifies when the extended protection policy should be enforced, the kind of protection enforced by the policy, and a custom Service Provider Name (SPN) list that is used to match against a client's SPN.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When this constructor is used to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy> class, the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy.PolicyEnforcement%2A> property is set to the `policyEnforcement` parameter, the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy.ProtectionScenario%2A> property is set to the `protectionScenario` parameter, and the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy.CustomServiceNames%2A> property is set to the `customServiceNames` parameter.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that specifies when the extended protection policy should be enforced, the kind of protection enforced by the policy, and a custom Service Provider Name (SPN) list that is used to match against a client's SPN.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When this constructor is used to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy> class, the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy.PolicyEnforcement%2A> property is set to the `policyEnforcement` parameter, the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy.ProtectionScenario%2A> property is set to the `protectionScenario` parameter, and the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy.CustomServiceNames%2A> property is set to the `customServiceNames` parameter.

Docs.summary: Gets a custom channel binding token (CBT) to use for validation.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ChannelBinding> that contains a custom channel binding to use for validation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This read-only property represents a custom channel binding token to use for validation. This is used in advanced scenarios when the CBT is provided by a custom outer channel. An example scenario might use this property in combination with <xref:System.Net.Security.SslStream> and <xref:System.Net.Security.NegotiateStream>.

Docs.summary: Gets the custom Service Provider Name (SPN) list used to match against a client's SPN.
Docs.value: A that contains the custom SPN list that is used to match against a client's SPN.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This read-only property indicates the custom SPN list that is used to match against a client's SPN. By default, the server will determine a default SPN list according to its registered endpoints. For scenarios which require SPN checking, this property can be specified using a using a constructor to override the default list used to match against the client’s SPN.

Docs.summary: Indicates whether the operating system supports integrated windows authentication with extended protection.
Docs.value: if the operating system supports integrated windows authentication with extended protection, otherwise .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The changes to support extended protection are currently available for applications on Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2. The extended protection features will be made available as updates for Windows Vista and Windows Server 2008. The extended protection features are not available on earlier versions of Windows.

Docs.summary: Gets when the extended protection policy should be enforced.
Docs.value: A value that indicates when the extended protection policy should be enforced.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This read-only property indicates when extended protection policy should be enforced (always, when supported by clients, or never).

Docs.summary: Gets the kind of protection enforced by the extended protection policy.
Docs.value: A value that indicates the kind of protection enforced by the policy.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This read-only property indicates the kind of protection enforced by the policy.
